body.p:
The Occidents for October have come
to hand, but no letter from you. By this time you will have
received my last p Abby Watson requesting you to obtain
50 copies of my catechism from the Sunday School in your city.
I have not a copy, and none are to be had here. I wish you
also to forward a couple dozen of Miss Peixottos Book, and about
3 dozen Henry's Class Books, of the Edition published in America.
On consideration you need not send Miss P's Books for Henry's
will answer my purpose as well. I require also about 1 dz
copies of Cohen's Hebrew Grammar on the Ellendorff? system
which you will oblige me by procuring. All these books I want
without delay, and the money shall be remitted as soon as
they arrive. On the inclosed tracing paper is the pattern of
the binding of a book, side and back. Send one of your daily
prayers (portuguese) similarly bound, color red maroon approaching to
red morocco. I had sold another copy of the Festival prayers
and if I get the money for them before an opportunity offers for forwarding
this, the money not I have in hand ($60) with that (nearly $20)
will be sent by same via. I have still on hand the 2 best bound
sets, 91 Vol deft.) and part of one set common sheep (3 deft.). If
your small Bibles were a dollar or $1 ½ each I could sell them
readily but 2 ½ people decline to give.
Have you ever felt an Earthquake? For a quarter of a century

I have been familiar with them, and their nature is such that,
totally different from other dangers to which one gets accustomed
They excite and increase our fears the oftener their shock is felt.
You become paralyzed, your faculties are suspended, the
will ceases to act on the voluntary parts of the body, and tho'
fully alive to the horrors of entombment, whether in or out of
doors, which threaten your life, you are incapable of making
the effort to move from the spot. To ejaculate a word or two
of prayer and in prospect of an immediate and awful death
which hundreds may share with you at the same moment is
all that your consciousness of the alarming extent of your peril
and the impossibility of escaping it, permits you to do. When
the earthquake is felt in the day time, a rush from the house to
the street may be effected by some one whom fear does not render
incapable of moving. At night however, when enfolded in the bonds
of sleep, you become suddenly awakened by the house shaking
and riding on its foundation, the upheaved and undulating
earth on which it rests, then can one realize in all its positive
meaning the פחד לילה the Psalmist speaks of. Not the bad dream
not the distressing night-mare, not the terrifying images which
a heated brain, a sickly fancy, or a superstitious mind
conjures up—but it is the awe of an instant dissolution, a
stern summons to give up life in a few seconds which stops
the beating of the heart, checks the current of the blood, and
“distils you to jelly with the effect of fear.”

On Thursday at ½ past 1 A M (23rd Decr.) the whole city was
on the verge of destruction from one of the severest earthquakes
I ever yet felt. A few seconds longer, say 3 or 4 and every

building would have fallen in and buried its inmates alive.
Truly, “God is merciful” or I would now not be writing.
Imagine, if you can, the house riding being lifted and down, rocking
from side to side, the walls shaking, beams, joists, rafters
roof, cracking, creaking as yielding to the irresistible force
of the subterranean movements, one and all writhed and struggled
to disjoint itself from mortise and tenon, to wrench itself from
the hold of girder, screw, and nail. My wife and I were awake
when it began. It must have lasted 15 seconds, some say half a
minute. Neither of us could move; both were calm & collected. I
never, during the agonizing interval, indulged the slightest hope
of deliverance, but momentarily expected to see the walls give way and
the roof fall in and crush us to death. Short as was the
continuance of the horrid throes of our “mother and our grave?”
they have left a never to be forgotten remembrance. Thanks be to
the Almighty, no life was lost, no one injured. But I fear that
every building has been so shaken that in case of a similar recur-
rence there may be loss of life and destruction of property.
Shortly after the occurrence, several places of worship were opened
and thronged by worshippers scared and trembling with affright. My
wife begged me not to leave her, and therefore I did not go. The
night was beautiful, moon and stars shining brilliantly, the
air cool and fresh. The occultation of Saturn took place that
night. There are many mining enterprises going forward on the
Island, and as the work is carried on through the whole 24 years hours
fears were entertained for the safety of the miners, but no accident
has been heard of, altho' the earthquake was severely felt in
the mining district.

Have you seen Dr. Kalisch's translation of Genesis. From
a review of it in the “Westminster Review,” whose tendencies
are rationalistic I have gleaned an extract or two. He has
not been more fortunate in his rendering of לא יסור שבט than his
predecessors. I do not like עד כי יבא שילה “tho' many flock to Shiloh.”
You may differ from me in opinion, but I prefer the translation
given in the “Israelite,” and ? the more I examine and
consider it with reference to history, the more am I convinced
of its truth. Onkelos and the masora have led the whole Jewish
and Christian world astray. שבט occurs 3 times in the chapter
and why the first time it should be translated “sceptre or
staff and the second & 3rd “tribes” I cannot understand. Again
why עמרם should not apply to the “confederated Israelites” when
Judah is blessed, and understood to allude to a portion of
that confederacy under the leadership of David and “דן ידין עמו” is
also an enigma to me. The passage is very simple, if the legitim
ate rendering of שבט be as “tribe” be given. Not shall depart
a tribe from Judah, nor a commander from between his feet
from among his followers until he come to Shiloh, and to him (Judah)
should be the gathering (assembling, marshalling, in array) of the
people The armed confederacy as it existed from the Exodus
to the division of the land among the tribes, was dissolved at
Shiloh, by Joshua. And the best proof that Judah was then
divested of the leadership is the divine permission to rescue
in Judges ? for a temporary purpose.

So our friend Gutheim is going to be married. I am
glad to hear of it, and wish him all happiness. Your
intended periodically weekly ought to succeed such an array of
talent taste and industry as Jacob, Raphall & yourself
is not often to be met with, and in the ranks of Israel is
an anomaly considering that our utterances rarely combine
to advance the General Good. I am glad the Pope still
refuses to give up the child of mortara; his obstinacy will
the sooner bring on the crisis in which the Papacy and
its supporters (Louis Napoleon & Austria) will be crushed.

body.p:
The proceedings of the Habane Bushi? at Constantinople are
very mischievous. United Israel in Europe should by means of
its enlightened Rabbi's abolish the power of Cherem & ?
and the whole of this irresponsible power so insolently assumed by
such fellows as the Turkish Rabbis. All this is the effect of the
dangerous precedents set by the Rabbinism? of the dark middle
ages, and its usurpation of a power which men like Akiba would
never have tolerated for an instant. It will be unquestionably
beneficial to the Turkish Jews Generally that their Rabbis have
aimed so high as the Rothschilds and Albert Cohen, who will now
keep them to break the gallery chain which ignorant zeal has bound
them. What say you? Is this stupid orthodoxy less dangerous to Israel
than cold rationalism? I say no.

Mrs. Nathan and her mother unite with me
in kind and friendly regards and trusting that you are
more cheerful and in higher spirits than when you last
wrote
